docs.snippet: We were this morning put in possession of still further intelligence of WALKER'S expedition to Hondu  ras. It is furnished to us from an authoritative source, and will perhaps help us to form an opinion of the probable fate of the party.

headline.main: GEN. WALKER'S EXPEDITION.; Probable Fate of the Party--The Feeling at Bay Islands--Excitement at Belize.

docs.lead_paragraph: We were this morning put in possession of still further intelligence of WALKER'S expedition to Hondu ras. It is furnished to us from an authoritative source, and will perhaps help us to form an opinion of the probable fate of the party.

docs.snippet: This day, upon the fair grounds of this County, there was held a barbecue, at which, among others, the Hon. JOHN J. CRITTENDEN spoke. I inclose his address, (he being the only man of National fame present,) omitting other reference to his associates...

headline.main: THE STATE OF PARTY.; Speech of Hon. John J. Crittenden, at Independence, Ky. Declares for the Union under all Circumstances--A Hard Hit at Breckinridge--Balm for the Douglasites. PRESIDENTIAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: This day, upon the fair grounds of this County, there was held a barbecue, at which, among others, the Hon. JOHN J. CRITTENDEN spoke. I inclose his address, (he being the only man of National fame present,) omitting other reference to his associates upon the stand, than to say that they generally made the best sort of Douglas speeches.

docs.snippet: We were this morning put in possession of still further intelligence of WALKER'S expedition to Honduras. It is furnished to us from an authoritative source, and will perhaps help us to form an opinion of the probable fate of the party.

headline.main: GEN. WALKER'S EXPEDITION.; Probable Fate of the Party--The Feeling at Bay Islands--Excitement at Belize.

docs.snippet: Our Minister Mr. McLANE leaves your City tomorrow on his return to Washington. He will probably take his departure for Mexico on the 20th, and goes prepared to carry out the policy, recently intimated through your columns, of cooperation with the...

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT THE NATIONAL CAPITAL.; The Movements of Minister McLane--His Return to Mexico--Political Prospects in Tennessee--The Pacific Telegraph--Military Movements, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our Minister Mr. McLANE leaves your City tomorrow on his return to Washington. He will probably take his departure for Mexico on the 20th, and goes prepared to carry out the policy, recently intimated through your columns, of cooperation with the European Powers for the pacification of Mexico.

headline.main: A Disconsolate Politician.; LETTER FROM HON. GERRIT SMITH.

docs.snippet: Judge DOUGLAS arrived here at 4  o'clock this morning, accompanied by his wife. All along the route, notwithstanding the untimely hour, meetings assembled at the depots, and loud calls were made for the Judge.

headline.main: DOUGLAS AND JOHNSON.; Senator Douglas at Elmira Demonstrations by the Way Another Speech. Herschel V. Johnson in Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge DOUGLAS arrived here at 4 o'clock this morning, accompanied by his wife. All along the route, notwithstanding the untimely hour, meetings assembled at the depots, and loud calls were made for the Judge.
